data.title: Ex-senator’s 3rd plea: Return 924 rai in Pathum Thani to temple
data.description: Despite three open letters from the former senator, no action has been taken to revoke the ownership of Alpine Golf Club and Ratchathani housing estate

data.title: MASTER claims title as Southeast Asia's leading cosmetic surgery provider partners with Indonesia's “Lumeo Health”
data.description: Master Style PCL ("MASTER") is setting its sights on becoming Southeast Asia's leading hub for cosmetic surgery, with a new partnership with Indonesia's Lumeo Health.

data.description: Industrial Estate Authority team tours leading Japanese companies for lessons in transitioning to circular economy

data.title: Thaksin positions Pheu Thai as conservative rival to People’s Party
data.description: Patriarch of ruling party condemns People’s Party stance on amending the lese majeste law during campaign for Udon Thani election.

data.description: Fund tells seminar it goes beyond offering financial assistance to media producers and content creators

data.title: India’s ‘Seven Sister States’ ripe for investment
data.description: Thai-Indian Business Council points to the many advantages its ‘high-end market’ offers to investors, especially in the country’s Northeast

data.title: Downpours forecast for Southern Thailand
data.description: Thai Meteorological Department confirm country will not be affected Typhoon Man-Yi which is currently heading towards Hainan

data.title: All that jazz: Royal compositions to be celebrated at upcoming concert
data.description: The Nation Group pays tribute to the late King Bhumibol Adulyadej the Great with next month’s “HM Blues” concert in Bangkok

data.title: US, China and India trade imbalances an opportunity for Thailand
data.description: With India’s population now surpassing that of China, Thailand must do more to capitalise on bilateral trade opportunities

data.title: Act now to drive sustainability and meet climate goals and government mandates
data.description: The floods in northern Thailand in 2024 had a widespread and crippling effect, impacting 8.6 million rai of land and causing an estimated economic loss of between THB 30 to 40 billion.

data.title: Cryptocurrency markets post-election: A new era in global finance
data.description: The surge of Bitcoin to a new all-time high surpassing $88,000 following the U.S. primary elections marks more than just market optimism – it signals a fundamental transformation in the global financial system.

data.title: BSRC, GISTDA, and Zoo Organization unite to boost biodiversity via geotech
data.description: Bangchak Sriracha Public Company Limited (BSRC) has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Geo-Informatics and Space Technology Development Agency (GISTDA) and the Zoological Park Organization under The Royal Patronage of H.M. The King.

data.title: Revolutionising education with AI
data.description: AI, the buzzword du jour, evokes a range of perceptions, from intimidation due to its potential to "steal our jobs", to inspiration from its vast opportunities. In a world where technology is advancing at an unprecedented pace, AI has permeated various aspects of our lives, particularly for Gen Alpha (born around 2010) who grew up with technology as close friends.

data.title: Curing loneliness
data.description: Studies have shown that loneliness and isolation can have a negative health impact, comparable to risks associated with smoking up to 15 cigarettes or drinking six glasses of alcohol per day.

data.title: Trumpet star Ibrahim Maalouf to perform in Bangkok
data.description: Twice Grammy-nominated trumpet superstar Ibrahim Maalouf will perform live in Bangkok for the first time at Lido Connect, Rama I Road, on Nov 26 at 7.30pm.

data.title: Siam Society marks 120 years with Rama V musical
data.description: To celebrate the 120th anniversary of its founding in the final years of the reign of King Rama V of the Chakri Dynasty, Siam Society presents a special musical performance titled 1907: Rama V European Operatic Journey at its auditorium. There are four rounds at 7pm on Nov 26, 28 and 30 and a matinee show at 4pm on Dec 1.

data.title: Catch a French classic at House Samyan
data.description: This November, cinema lovers in Bangkok have the rare opportunity to experience one of the most groundbreaking films in history on the big screen. Breathless (À Bout De Souffle), Jean-Luc Godard

data.title: BSRC, GISTDA and Zoological Park Organization Join Forces to Enhance Biodiversity Using Space and Geoinformatics Technology
data.description: Bangchak Sriracha Public Company Limited (BSRC) has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Geo-Informatics and Space Technology Development Agency (GISTDA) and the Zoological Park Organization under The Royal Patronage of H.M. The King.

data.title: Act now and prioritise sustainability transformation to combat climate change and meet government mandates.
data.description: The floods in northern Thailand in 2024 had a widespread and crippling effect, impacting 8.6 million rai of land and causing an estimated economic loss of between THB 30 to 40 billion. However, a more comprehensive analysis by Krungsri Research paints a far grimmer picture, projecting total losses of up to THB 46.5 billion, including a staggering THB 43.4 billion in agricultural output and THB 3.1 billion in property damage.

data.title: Cryptocurrency Markets Post-Election: A New Era in Global Finance
data.description: The surge of Bitcoin to a new all-time high surpassing $88,000 following the U.S. primary elections marks more than just market optimism – it signals a fundamental transformation in the global financial system. This milestone, set against the backdrop of significant political and policy shifts, indicates a deeper evolution in how digital assets are perceived and integrated into the mainstream financial landscape.

data.title: Central shopping centres featuring region-inspired Christmas trees
data.description: Initiative seeks to position Thailand as world-class destination for global festivities

data.title: Pheu Thai upbeat on winning more than 200 House seats in next poll

data.title: Malaysian singer treated fairly, Corrections Department says
data.description: A popular Malaysian singer is being treated fairly and respectfully in Narathiwat Provincial Prison, according to a Corrections Department statement published on Sunday.

data.title: Pheu Thai insists on simple majority principle for referendum bill
data.description: Compromising proposal calls for ‘one and a half’ majority requirement

data.title: Miss Thailand praised after finishing fourth in Miss Universe
data.description: Though Miss Thailand, Suchata “Opal” Chuangsri, won fourth place in Miss Universe 2024 in Mexico on Sunday, several fans in Thailand praised her for her achievement in the final round of five pageants.

data.title: High-value agriculture to be enhanced next year, govt department vows
data.description: The Department of Agricultural Extension plans to develop high-value agriculture further next year, as the department has witnessed a 1.5-times increase in Thai farmers’ income this year.

data.title: Bangkok set to dazzle for a month with spectacular light shows
data.description: Spectacular light shows and cultural showcases are being held for a month at eight venues along the Chao Phraya River in Bangkok in a bid to attract Thai and foreign visitors.

data.title: More than 50,000 people expected to attend Impact’s Loy Krathong event
data.description: Balloons portraying different animals, including a tyrannosaurus rex, are among attractions at the Loy Krathong event being held near Muang Thong Thani lake in Nonthaburi province, event organiser Impact Exhibition and Convention Centre said.
